creditline: Gift of Dennis Adrian in honor of Mary Cullen and in memory of Roy Cullen
inscription:
(a): Titled along top edge of sheet in ink:I AM FOUR EYES FROM THE PLANET CALLED THE RED TORNADO
(b): Titled across top edge of sheet in ink: I AM BLIND AND I CAN SEE YOUR FUTURE FROM MY PLANET LOVELY
medium: Ballpoint pen and crayon on brown paper, diptych
provenance: Dennis Adrian, Seaside, Oregon, until 2017; given to MIA, 2017.
signed: (a) signed, URC: H Clark | (b) signed, URC: H Clark
text: Self-taught artist Henry Ray Clark developed the creative persona of an extraterrestrial with fantastic powers. Clark’s belief was sincere: “I know they are out there, ” he said, “because I have been there. Every night when I go to bed, I travel in my spaceship going to all of the places I put on these papers.” Clark was convicted of a crime and spent years in the Texas prison system, where he turned to drawing as a psychological release from extended periods of confinement and isolation. This ink and crayon diptych exemplifies Clark’s fascination with richly detailed pattern and line. Clark said, “They can lock my body up, but they can't lock up my mind. As long as my mind can create something beautiful to look at I am a free man and I will live forever in my art.” The interpretation and meaning of the two abstract compositions is elusive and is left to the viewer.
title: I am Four Eyes from the Planet Called the Red Tornado / I am Blind and I Can See your Future from my Planet Lovely
